definition: half/semi-/incomplete/(after a number) and a half
to decline/to wane/to become weak or feeble
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: And again, the half-life is always useful.
Radioactive iodine has a half-life of eight days and decays naturally within weeks.
sentences.chinese: 放射性碘的半衰期爲八天，幾周內自然衰變。

sentences.english: Business opportunities have a half-life, just like uranium.
sentences.chinese: 商業機會有半衰期，就像鈾一樣。

sentences.english: THE half-life of official opposition to nuclear power in Britain has been very short.
sentences.chinese: 在英國，官方反對使用核能的半衰期很短。

sentences.english: Currently, PEGylation is commonly used as an effective method to prolong its half-life in serum.
sentences.chinese: 聚乙二醇修飾是目前有效地延長其半衰期的方法。

sentences.english: Higher blood concentration of ceftiofur and longer half life can be observed when administered together with probenecid.
sentences.chinese: 與丙磺舒合用可提高血中藥物濃度和延長半衰期。

sentences.english: Their half-life in the body is estimated to be seven to eleven years.
sentences.chinese: 它們在體內的半衰期估計爲7至11年。

sentences.english: It is not necessary to wait until half of a sample has decayed in order to measure the halflife .
sentences.chinese: 不必一直等到樣品衰變一半之後才測量它的半衰期。

sentences.english: Alongside uranium, other elements of greater concern are those with much longer half-lives.
sentences.chinese: 除了鈾，更令人關注的其他元素與更長的半衰期人。

sentences.english: This radioactive element has a half-life of some 5, 700 years.
sentences.chinese: 這種放射性元素半衰期約爲5700年。

sentences.english: Half-lives range from fractions of a second to billions of years.
sentences.chinese: 半衰期從幾分之一秒至數十億美元的範圍。

sentences.english: The halflife of literature and core periodical…
sentences.chinese: 對文獻半衰期和核心期刊等作了探討。

sentences.english: Half-life is the time required for half the quantity of the protein to be broken down and eliminated from the joint space.
sentences.chinese: 半衰期指一半蛋白從關節腔中分解和消失用的時間。

pinyin: fang4 she4 xing4 tong2 wei4 su4

definition: potency/titer (measure of effective concentration in virology or chemical pathology, defined in terms of potency after dilution by titration)/valence (perceived value in psychology)/valency
deuterium 2H/heavy hydrogen, isotope of hydrogen having 1 neutron in its nucleus, so atomic weight 2
